translations.name: Geneva Bible
translations.description: The Geneva Bible was the primary text of 16th century Protestantism and one of the most historically significant translations of the Bible into English. Published in 1560, it preceded the King James translation by 51 years. The English Dissenters and Reformers who were unhappy with the Anglican Church preferred The Geneva Bible over the other protestant translations. It is known for its forceful language and the scriptural study guides, periscopes, maps, tables, woodcut illustrations, and indices that make it the world’s first study Bible.
